name: Obsidian Minotaur
immunities: acid, fire, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren’t adamantine
conimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can’t speak

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the obsidian minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The minotaur is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The minotaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The minotaur’s weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The obsidian minotaur makes one gore attack and two claw attacks.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Burning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The obsidian minotaur expels a cloud of superheated gas that fills a 10-foot cube adjacent to it.. The gas fades after the end of the minotaur’s next turn. Creatures who enter the area or start their turn there must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 31 (9d6) fire damage and it is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half the damage and is not poisoned.
